From Introduction:

Inu Yasha is the latest successful manga epic by Rumiko Takahashi, the author and artist who in the past has brought us One Pound Gospel, Urusei Yatsura, Ranma 1/2, and the Mermaid Saga. Inu Yasha is set primarily in Japan's feudal age, or Sengoku period. Obviously, the Fuzion edition of the game Sengoku, by Gold Rush Games, will be of some importance in running an Inu Yasha game.

114910.name: Vigilantian: Eternal Vigilance
114910.description:
From Introduction:

Vigilantian: Eternal Vigilance is a sourcebook for Vigilantian RPG. This book offers four key features for your campaign. Character LifePath, Sample NPC characters, Super-Normal Powers, and Vehicles. In the first chapter expands on the Character Creation system, adding to it a LifePath system (derived from Atomik Lifepath), new Character Templates, and new Skills. The second chapter "Supporting Cast" covers a few sample NPC characters that can be placed into any campaign. Chapter Three is one of the major chapters of interest in this book, covering Super-Normal powers - that is, super powers for a very street level super vigilante campaign. The forth and final chapter discusses the automotive side of vigilantism, utilizing Atomik MotorWarz as its primary source material. Chapter Four also gives some additional information and technology on vehicles in the early 21st Century.

Vigilantian: Eternal Vigilance should be an invaluable source for expanding not only Vigilantian, but any Fuzion game of a similar genre. Super-Normal Powers can be adapted for use in any campaign (with the GM's permission), and the NPCs are generic enough to be found almost anywhere.

114911.name: Haar-Spielerei
114911.description: Rapunzel is coming home to her tower and wants to tell about her adventures - if she has forgotten the word for something she uses her magical hair to draw the item. Each player receives a tower. In your turn you look at a hair tile and use the hair string to lay out the contours of the item. The others guess, who guesses correctly receives the tile and adds it to his tower. Special cards win or lose you cards. If you have added four tiles to your tower you win.

114912.description:
4049: The galaxy hums with prosperity and peace two millennia after the dawn of space travel. But as mankind and its neighbors colonized the stars, the burgeoning need for resources was apparent. One by one, new geological discoveries revolutionized terraform, construction and energy technology. The sub-temperature properties of the mineral Ice-9 allowed life-giving water to flow on uninhabitable planets. Crystallized Cobalt was accidentally found to be incredibly strong, resistant to extreme pressure. And a single chunk of Deuterium could power a sprawling metropolis for a month!

As a plucky entrepreneur you must explore the edges of space searching for precious minerals. Will you buy the fastest ship in the sector or hire the best pilot in the galaxy? Purchase the latest state-of-the-art gadgets, invest in planetary refineries, or pay off your rising debt? The cargo you haul could be worth fortune, so grab your helmet and suit up! The cosmos and a mountain of credits call!

In Starship Merchants, each player runs a fledgling corporation looking to stake a claim in the lucrative mining business. Player will buy starships, explore the galaxy and deliver cargo for interstellar credits, all the while expanding their operations.

Starting at the shipyard and ending at the dock, players will move clockwise around the four quadrants on the board to complete an entire Business Cycle. During each turn, a player either performs one action at the current quadrant or advances to the next, performing an action there. As players take actions or advance they spread apart across all four quadrants while completing individual Business Cycles.

The Shipyard is where you can buy a speedy scout or a heavy load bearing tug. The Market is where Gear, Pilots, Refineries, and claims can be purchased. In the belt, starships are run by spending energy points to explore, pickup mines, or fly to another destination. The final quadrant is the Dock where delivered cargo is traded for credits.

A player that ends his turn at the Dock with 100+ credits can declare the Final Run, ending the game. But after completing the Final Run, the player with the most credits wins!
114912.name: Starship Merchants

114913.name: Outerspatial
114913.description:
User Summary

Control a fixed cannon in space. You have a lot of flexibility in how you will upgrade your command. Every few seconds you will have the ability to build a new ship, many types of ships are available, and new ships can be unlocked as well as upgrades for those ships. Survive as long as you can, and build experience, the experience will carry over to the next round.

114914.name: NanoGames
114914.description:
Five games for the price of one (and that one is free!).

NanoGames contains five business card sized games.

- Battle Lines: Destroy the enemy and invade his base.
- Business Card Derby: Destroy your opponent's car before he destroys yours.
- Elbow Room: Place and slide your pieces to create a path from your base to your opponents.
- Jump-n-Spin: Get across the board by jumping over your own counters, or swapping places with your opponent's.
- The Lineup Shuffle: Create a line of four counters be sliding in from any edge.

Download the file and print on cardstock. Cut the two sides apart and glue together with the Blue and Red ends lined up. Cut the pieces from the ends and you are ready to play. Each NANOgame is fully self contained, with all the counters and rules you need. I recommend #2 coin envelopes for storage, to keep all the pieces together.

114915.name: Bohême 1618
114915.description:
This 2 players wargame will be included in VaeVictis magazine.

It covers the event of summer 1618 during which the Bohemian parliament faced the power of the Habsbourg emperor. Armies will face each others to battle for the control of Bohemia and the competition of influence will also take place in the different regional Diets to join a side.

Each player controls armies (composed of cavalry, infantry and artillery) under different generals. These armies will receive orders to conduct operations aiming at controlling or pillaging territories, destroying enemies or besieging cities.
Each player tries to control the largest amount of towns in Bohemia and particularly the capital Prague.
Combats and sieges are resolved with a roll to hit system using a d6. At the end of fights some of the routes units can be rallied, some are lost and some might potentially switch side.
Both sides also have resources they they can spend to supply armies or influence votes in regional diets to obtain their supports.
Random events will also affect the campaign such as snow, pillages, uprising or political shifts.

This is an operational level game with 108 counters and requires just a few coins (pennies will do) and a d6.

114916.name: Paint the Fence
114916.description:
User Summary

You have to paint fences, but it's not so easy. You have a time limit for each level, obstacles to avoid, and multiple colors to place in the correct area. But don't despair, gifts along the way will make things easier for you.

114917.name: Compact Heroes Master Set
114917.description:
designer description

The Compact Heroes Master Set includes everything you need to play the Compact Heroes role-playing card game with the exception of a pen or pencil. Included in this comprehensive boxed set are more than 150 cards, two six-sided dice, and one twenty-sided die.

The cards are comprised of the various race cards, many items both magical and mundane, skills ranging from the novice level all the way to master, spells, several monsters of various levels, and even a pre-made adventure!

Compact Heroes is played like a traditional role-playing game but with the portability of a card game. No large books or bags of dice to lug around, and yet you get the same sandboxy experience of a traditional role-playing game. And because it's skill based, the options are nearly endless on how you advance your character.

114918.name: Absolute Chess
114918.description:
User Summary

Absolute Chess is a chess game released on DSiWare, featuring lessons on basic and advance stratagies, a Challenge Mode with missions to complete, and DS Download Play to play with a friend.

114919.name: AFL Premiership 2006
114919.description:
AFL Premiership 2006 is a simulation game only for the PlayStation 2 based on the AFL. The game was developed by Australian games developer IR Gurus and was published by Sony Computer Entertainment under the SCEE label. It was released on 20 July 2006 and is the tenth game in the AFL video game series. The game was only released in Australia. Commentary includes, Dennis Cometti, Dermott Brereton, and Christi Malthouse.

Features that were in AFL Premiership 2005 include "Career mode", which lets the player play in the pre-season, home and away season, and finals. There is also, player trading, National AFL Draft and player development. AFL Tribunal is also used with in-game reports and suspensions. Player development can improve players or newly drafted rookies. "Mission Mode", allows the player to choose one of the 16 teams and simulate a game from the chosen teams historical match. "Training mode", allows the player to practice on a reginal oval before playing in the main modes.

Source: Wikipedia, "AFL Premiership 2006", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114920.name: 6 Godling Feats
114920.description:
From the introduction:

Six feats designed to expand the roles and utility of the four godling character classes and similar godling-powered characters, useable with The Genius Guide to the Godling, The Genius Guide to the Godling Ascendant, and The Genius Guide to Mystic Godlings.

114921.name: The Oil Blue
114921.description:
The Oil Blue is an indie action-sim that has you drilling for oil in the world's oceans, selling barrels of oil on the market, and exploring new islands once you completed objectives set by your employer, the United Oil of Oceania company. Set in the ocean in the near future, the world's dependency on oil has grown to an even larger amount. It’s up to you and a crew of men to travel the ocean, find abandoned oil drilling islands, and reclaim them for the United Oil of Oceana company.

Once you land on an island, you have a set amount of days and oil barrels to make during your stay. Fire up those old drilling machines and start making oil underwater, watch the oil barrel market and sell at the highest price, repair machines and do it all within the time you’re given or the UOO will boot you off the island for a better crew. Sell more barrels to achieve higher ranks and perks, upgrade your machines, and conquer the ocean!

Source: The Developer Website.

114922.name: AFL Premiership 2007
114922.description:
AFL Premiership 2007 is a sports simulation game for the PlayStation 2 based on the Australian Football League. Its is a follow up game to AFL Premiership 2006 and the final game in the series to be developed by IR Gurus.

Single match is the quickest way to play a game. On the single match summary screen you can set your favourite team and then randomise the other settings. Such as, home and away teams, stadium, weather, and rules (pre-season or home and away season rules). Mission Mode allows you to take up the challenge and feel the pressure with these historical matches. Each mission has a handicap that a team must overcome; from seemingly impossible score deficits, to slim leads with seconds left on the clock. Career Mode takes you from season to season, including a calendar view of the fixtures, training to guide your players’ development, season stats for all the players in the league, leaderboards for all stats categories, Brownlow, Coleman, Club best and fairest awards, Best on Ground awards for each match.

Source: Wikipedia, "AFL Premiership 2007", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114923.name: Dino D-Day
114923.description:
Dino D-Day is a frantic, action-packed multiplayer game that will transport you to a World War II that should have been. You and your friends will battle online choosing to serve the cause of the Allied nations or Adolf Hitler. The Allied side includes six playable characters each with unique weapons and abilities to use in combat. Gun down a Dilophosaur with your trusty M1 Garand, blast a kamikaze pterosaur out of the sky with your Thompson sub-machine gun, toss out a dead jack rabbit to lure a raptor into a trap.

As an Axis player you will have your choice of three human classes and three dinosaur classes. Ambush your enemy with speed and stealth as the Raptor, mercilessly pound the enemy with the Desmatosuchus’ heavy 20mm gun, rampage through enemy groups as the Dilophosaur, pick up a body and throw it at an enemy for a double kill! The German soldier classes are the perfect complement to their dinosaur comrades.

Source: The Game Website.

114924.name: Air Ranger: Rescue Helicopter
114924.description:
Air Ranger: Rescue Helicopter is a helicopter simulator video game released for the Sony Play Station 2, developed by ASK Corporation and published by Midas The game was released on March 29, 2001 in Japan, and November 15, 2002 for Europe. The game was never released in North America. In the game the player must take the roll of a Rescue Helicopter pilot, and complete missions involving accidents such as car crashes or fires.

Source: Wikipedia, "Air Ranger: Rescue Helicopter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114925.name: Alfa Romeo Racing Italiano
114925.description:
Alfa Romeo Racing Italiano, known in Europe as SCAR (an acronym for Squadra Corse Alfa Romeo), is a PlayStation 2, Windows and Xbox racing video game developed by Milestone S.r.l. and released in 2005. It is similar to the Gran Turismo series. The game was lauded for having artificial intelligence superior to Gran Turismo 4. When compared to Gran Turismo 4, Alfa Romeo Racing Italiano has far fewer cars and tracks. All the cars in the game are manufactured by the Alfa Romeo motor company (unlike Gran Turismo which has vehicle makes and models from countries from Australia to Sweden). While most of the tracks are in Italy, a few are in other countries like Germany and the United States. With a maximum of nine laps in any race, with most races lasting only three to six laps, the races are too short for the game to model pit stops.

A distinguishing feature of the game is that it models driver development using a system almost identical to a console role-playing game. In addition, cars get damaged, both visibly and in performance, by collisions or by driving off course.

Like many racing games, the game has a quick race mode and a career mode (called dynasty mode). The initial choices of cars and tracks in quick race mode are very limited; additional choices are unlocked by progress in dynasty mode. Initially, dynasty mode has a limited number of events available to enter. Placing third or better in races unlocks new races, series of races, and championships. At the same time, the game models the development of the driver using a system that is almost identical to a console role-playing game.
The player has just overtaken his opponent for experience points in the middle of a race.

This elaborate system of developing the driver's experience is used to toughen up both the player and the car that he or she uses. Experience points (referred to in the game simply as XP), are acquired for various achievements during a race, such as passing opponents, or driving a clean lap. Similar to the way that XP is lost after dying in some role-playing games, failing to finish the race cancels all XP earned in the event. When certain thresholds of XP are reached, a new driver level is achieved, and a Skill Point is awarded. These Skill Points can be used to develop driver and car. Additional Skill Points are awarded for other achievements. Some races award a skill point for beating a particular opponent for the first time. There is also a list of dynasty achievements, the completion of which awards a number Skill Points. One such achievement, for example, is going faster than a certain speed in dynasty mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alfa Romeo Racing Italiano", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114926.name: America's 10 Most Wanted
114926.description:
America's 10 Most Wanted, released as Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror in the US was mainly received negatively due to its dated graphics and uninspired boss battles. It contains tracks and cameos by members of So Solid Crew.

Set in the present, the game places the player into the role of Jake Seaver, a CIFR agent. Travelling to locations such as Utah, Paris, and Miami, the game finalises in Afghanistan, where the player must capture Saddam Hussein and Osama Bin Laden. The game contains 10 levels, one for each fugitive respectively, as well as a preceding introductory level. The game is a typical first person shooter, featuring arcade-style, third person fights as means of capturing the level-in-question's fugitive.

Source: Wikipedia, "America's 10 Most Wanted (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114927.name: American Idol
114927.description:
American Idol (known as Pop Idol in Europe) is a music video game based on the Fox Network show American Idol developed by former name of Rockstar Leeds, Mobius Entertainment and published by Codemasters.

The gameplay consists of pressing buttons in time to judge the character's singing.

Source: Wikipedia, "American Idol (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114928.name: AMF Xtreme Bowling
114928.description:
User Summary

Players can customize a bowler and gradually compete against better and better opponents in 9 alleys, each made unique by alley backgrounds and the ball's different action. As players win, they increase their abilities of power, accuracy and spin control.

The action of the ball and pins can be toggled to be more realistic, just as the game can be put into different modes of pin or match challenge as well as quick match, league, or tournament play.

114929.name: Super Real Mahjong
114929.description:
User Summary

Super Real Mahjong was a Japanese only arcade mahjong game.

The player takes the role of a male who encounters different female characters and plays games of Mahjong with them. If he wins, they strip for him and the player then moves on to another game of Mahjong with another girl.

114930.name: 8 Bit Rally
114930.description:
Revisit the good old days of arcade racers with 8 bit Rally, the upcoming game developed by Photon Creations.

Race on tracks all around the world, through some of the harshest and picturesque environments against 19 other competitors all aiming for the prized 8 Bit Cup.

Earn prize money from races, purchase car upgrades & new car models, gaining that edge over the competition.

8 bit Rally is coming soon to iPhone, iPod Touch, iPad & MacOSX* with these great features:

40 Tracks
40 tracks set over 6 continents. Race through the deserts of Africa, the tundra of Siberia, the jungles of South America, and many more challenging environments.

Cars & Upgrades
Upgrade your wheels, transmission, and engine to gain the edge over the competition. Choose from a list of car paintjobs across 3 different car models.

Original Soundtrack
Race while listening to retro tunes made specifically for 8 bit Rally. Music developed by the talented Poisoncut: @errozerodesign

Source: The Game Website.

114931.name: Block the Laser
114931.description:
User Summary

Each level is a grid. Your goal is to move a robot through a room filled with deadly lasers. Fortunately, mirrors, doors, turnstiles, and other obstacles and machines can redirect, block, or otherwise change the lasers and clear a path to the exit.

Block the Laser features 50 levels of progressive difficulty.

114932.name: Tigers Unleashed
114932.description:
The enemy is out there... somewhere in the first light of dawn. Waiting. You've made your plans. Issued your orders. The forces are ready, confidence is high. The sharp report of a machine gun signals that contact has been made. What seemed so clear just moments before, now starts to become cloudy. The sounds of heavy weapons echo though the valleys around you. You move slightly to obtain a better viewpoint. Some of the fighting you can now see directly. Some you can hear. Some, though, you know only from the reports coming in from your units or the flashes of the guns in the distance. Smoke can be seen drifting up behind the trees where your tank support was stationed. Why? Are they still there? Are they firing? And what are those dust trails off in the distance?

As doubts begin to creep in, critical time is spent getting new orders to your units. Your well-laid plans are crumbling, as you frantically try to get ahead of the situation. Desperate, you find yourself guessing and hoping, because you're still unsure of exactly where the enemy is. Cursing yourself for not keeping a reserve close at hand, you briefly think about A Company out in those advanced positions. They've been taking heavy artillery fire, and you haven't heard anything from them in what seems like ages... and now the dust trails are getting closer on the exposed left flank. A lieutenant appears, “Sir, B Company is pinned down and almost out of ammo, while C Company is stuck at a blown bridge. We still have no word from A Company, and the tanks are late. What are your orders?

Welcome to the world of the combat commander.

Tigers Unleashed is a unique, ultra-realistic tactical/grand-tactical level combat simulation set on the Eastern Front of World War Two between 1939-1942. It is a strategy-type game, where the player assumes the role of a combat Task Force Commander responsible for anything from a ski infantry company to a heavy panzer battlegroup. The basic units are squads and platoons, which are used as building blocks to create larger units.

What makes Tigers Unleashed different from other wargames is its focus. It provides a physically and historically accurate portrayal of tactical combat, with special emphasis on the experience of command. It puts you squarely in the leader's role, simulating conditions as he would actually experience them. Here, information and communications are all-important. Your soldiers are humans - and they act like it. Your orders take time to process and implement. Fog of war is pervasive - often leaving you with incomplete and/or outdated information.

Tigers Unleashed is not a “beer-and-pretzels” type of game, though it does include user-settable modes that allow it to be played in a more relaxed manner. Instead, Tigers Unleashed is:

Exactingly realistic, using rigorous physics and empirical material properties in firing, damage, sighting, communications, and weather modeling.
Profoundly detailed, including individual round calculations, positions to the nearest meters for each weapon system (tank, soldier, gun, etc.), exact communications transmissions (including radio, visual, smoke, and runners), dust trails, forest fires, and urban warfare among many other things.
Historical, containing in-depth information and data such as weapons system and ammunition specifications and tables of organization for all combatants on the Eastern Front from platoon to division level. It also includes a Sandbox Utility that can be used as a “combat calculator” for other games or miniatures.

And this barely begins to scrach the surface. Tigers Unleased is also:

Comprehensive, encompassing land, naval, and air combat systems, along with a myriad of combat support types such as combat/construction engineers, spotters, command and control units, mines, obstacles, improved positions, airborne drops, naval landings, special operations, tunnels, rail units, and much more.
Military-based. It incorporates many types of military command and control measures such as SOP's, DF/IF targeting points, and communication messages.
Supremely customizable, as players can change fog of war levels, command/control delay, unit values, force structures, weather, map scale, time scale, and a host of other factors. It also uses “geo-morphic” maps which allow players to quickly create playing areas of their choice in terms of terrain and size.

The AI in Tigers Unleashed can do almost everything a human player can, including force selection and placement, placement of obstacles and engineering works, formulating and issuing unit orders, targeting, calling for artillery and air support, and managing information. In fact, the AI Adjutant is always at the player's side to help him with these functions as well.

Source: The Publisher Website.

114933.name: Glowfish
114933.description:
"Free Coralline from Dr. Urchin in this magical underwater platform adventure! Navigate your way through the twists and turns of each maze level with a fluid control system. Circle enemies to fire your bubbles and win each battle!"

Source: The Game Website.

User Summary

In this gorgeous game, you control a glowfish charged with rescuing his lady friend from the evil Dr. Urchin. Navigate 50 colorful ocean landscapes with dual-stick controls. Along the way you can pick up allies who will aid in your quest.

114934.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Food Fight: Snack Attack is a forty-card expansion for Food Fight that introduces lots of new food-based characters, each with a unique power, as well as a new "Live the Dream" game mechanism.

You need the original Food Fight base game in order to use Food Fight: Snack Attack.
114934.name: Food Fight: Snack Attack

114935.name: Hidden Trees
114935.description:
A Faulkner party game.

Each guest at your party is given a card with 24 cryptic clues about various types of tree.

Example
Clue: A Joiner's Tool
Answer: A Plane tree

The participant who gets the most correct answers during the evening, wins.

114936.name: Trav-L-Bingo
114936.description:
A game to make a long car journey a little easier.

Each player (hopefully not including the driver!) is given a 5 x 5 bingo card. The cards feature various things you might see out of the windows during the trip. If you see something, announce it to the other players (who can check that you aren't cheating), and then mark the item on your card.

A long game could be all the 25 items on your card. But a shorter game should be that the winner is the first player to complete a line of items.

Made by Gulf, the oil and petrol supplier, and mailed out in an envelope so no box needed. As the bingo cards need to be cut up into single cards, I would guess this is a pretty rare item to find in its complete, original shape.

114937.name: Larva Mortus
114937.description:
"At the end of the 19th century, dark forces shade the world once again. A brave agent experienced in exorcism and combat faces the incoming evil and fights loathsome supernatural monsters and horrific spawns of black magic.

Larva Mortus offers fast and entertaining monster-hunting gameplay. Cheesy horror atmosphere goes hand in hand with furious action splatterfest.

Features:

- 30 frightful supernatural monsters to destroy. Vampires, undead, werewolves and more!

- Solid arsenal varying from classic pistols and shotgun to fancy “dynamo gun”.

- Randomly generated missions for high replay value.

- Main character development through set of RPG-like features.

- Many environments from spooky manors to catacombs to dark forests.

- Animated comix cutscenes.

- Dark orchestral music score.

- And gore can be turned off if you like."

Source: The Publisher Website.

114938.name: Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor 2

videogamehonor.34232: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Handheld Game of the Year Winner

114938.description:
Unlike the first game in the series, Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor, where the plot centers around Tokyo, Devil Survivor 2 spans all of Japan. It focuses on a set of Japanese high school students who receive an email showing a video of them dying from a mysterious website that predicts deaths. When strange creatures invaded the country, the students form a pact enabling them to summon demons. Like its predecessor, this game also features multiple endings but has enhanced gameplay via a character relationship system.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Megami_Tensei%3A_Devil_Survivor_2 Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114939.name: Skywire
114939.description:
User Summary
Skywire is a simple physics-based game in which you control a tram through what can only be an amusement park that has been overrun by various animals. By controlling the acceleration and deceleration of the tram along a fixed path, you must avoid obstacles to get your passengers to the end of the track. Each collision knocks a passenger out of your car, and three hits ends the level.

114940.name: Skywire 2
114940.description:
User Summary
Skywire 2 sees a return to the amusement park gone wild from the original. Once again, you must pilot your tram car along a fixed track by accelerating or decelerating it to avoid obstacles. There are many new obstacles and enemy patterns, as well as new hazards like degrading track, that will attempt to stop you from getting your passengers to the end of the line. Too many collisions with these dangerous animals and all your passengers will fall from your car, and you'll have to start the level over.

Additionally, the game includes a two player competitive mode where you can challenge a friend, using the same keyboard, to see who can complete the level faster and with the most passengers.

114941.name: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

114941.description:
User Summary

Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition contains the DLC Undead Nightmare, Legends and Killers, Liars and Cheats, Myths and Mavericks, Outlaws to the End, and the minor DLC Hunting and Trading Outfits Pack, Deadly Assassin Outfit, Golden Guns Weapon Pack, Solomon's Folly single-player gang hangout, and the War Horse.

114942.name: Enemy 585: The Last Henchman
114942.description:
User Summary
In Enemy 585, the "hero" has rampaged his way through all 8 castles and defeated the final boss, finally to return home and rest. In his wake of destruction he destroyed all the henchmen... except one! Somehow, Henchman 585 has avoided squashing, and now it is up to you, a sentient collection of square blocks, to guide him back to the hero's home for revenge.

To play, you move and rotate a group of blocks so that they are positioned to manipulate the movement of the henchman, who moves forward until he comes to an obstacle of at least two blocks (in which case he changes direction). By providing bridges or obstacles, you can change his path to reach the end of the level, as well as help him hit switches, kick old enemy helmets, or otherwise manipulate items along the way. As an additional challenge, there are several coins to collect in each level for bonuses.

As well as being made in a retro style, this game toys with many of the conventions of early platformers. For instance, the main direction of progression is to the left, and you start at level 8-4, trying to reach level 1-1.

114943.name: Mystery Case Files: Escape from Ravenhearst
114943.description:
The terror of Ravenhearst Manor rises again

You lived through their side of the story-now live through his!

Dozens of bodies have recently disappeared from the small town of Blackpool. Rumors link the missing bodies to the town's once-majestic Ravenhearst Manor, but the local authorities are baffled. With no concrete leads, the townspeople are fearing the worst.

Return to the scene of a tragic destiny and learn more about this poignant saga. What you find could very well be the final chapter of this riveting story-if you escape!

Source: The Game Website.

114944.name: Die große Salzkarawane
114944.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Im Küstenstaat Corua erhalten die Abenteurer von dem Händler Don Gisefo al-Aktuf den Auftrag, die Hinterlassenschaft seines Onkels aus der Wüstenstadt Hama abzuholen und nach Nedschef zu bringen. Die erste Etappe der langen Reise führt nach Qum-al-Naschir, einer kleinen Siedlung am Nordrand der Wüste von Eschar und von dort in ein Asad-Lager. Die Abenteurer erhalten die Erlaubnis, sich der alljährlichen Salzkarawane des Stammes anzuschließen, die auf ihrer Reise in Hama Station macht. Ohne Wissen der Asad gehört ein Teilnehmer der Karawane einer finsteren Sekte an. Sein Ziel ist es, den Erfolg der Unternehmung zu sabotieren und so den Ruf des Karawanenführers zu ruinieren.

Das Abenteuer ist für eine Gruppe von 4 bis 6 Spielerfiguren mit einer Gradsumme zwischen 17 und 22 vorgesehen. Die Abenteurer erfahren, was es heißt, die unwirtlichen Wüsten von Eschar zu bereisen. Sie müssen Durst, Erschöpfung und brennende Hitze ertragen, sich von übellaunigen Kamelen, Sandstürmen und Wüstengeistern plagen lassen und obendrein noch einen geheimnisvollen Feind aufspüren, bevor dieser sie alle ins Verderben stürzen kann.


Translation:

In the coastal state of Corua the adventurers receive from the dealer Don Gisefo al-Aktuf the order to pick up the legacy of his uncle from the desert city of Hama and bring it to Nedschef. The first stage of the long journey leads to Qum-al-Naschir, a small settlement on the northern edge of the desert of Eschar and from there to an Asad camp. The adventurers will receive permission to join the annual salt caravan of the tribe, which makes station in Hama on its journey. Without knowledge of the Asad a participant in the caravan is a member of a sinister cult. His goal is to sabotage the success of the enterprise, thus ruining the reputation of the caravan leader.

The adventure is designed for a group of 4 to 6 players with a level sum figures 17 to 22 The adventurers will learn what it means to travel to the inhospitable deserts of Eschar. They have to endure thirst, exhaustion and burning heat, are plagued by ill-tempered camels, sandstorms and desert spirits and on top of that have to track down a mysterious enemy before it can all fall into ruin.

videogameversion.141228: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114945.description:
User Summary

This single player VS AI game is a simple Darts game. You control the darts with a keyboard.

114946.name: Drawn: Trail of Shadows

videogamehonor.29982: 2012 D.I.C.E. Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee

114946.description:
Re-enter the enchanted world of Drawn in the highly anticipated third installment of the cinematic series. Set in the years before the events of The Painted Tower and Dark Flight, Drawn: Trail of Shadows takes players on a magical journey through the distant past. Become a part of the story by following clues scattered throughout paintings to save a boy with the power to create painted worlds. Discover and confront the source of evil that seeks to possess that power...

See the world of Drawn as never before while traveling deep into each painting. Explore a fantastic garden; climb high into frozen mountain passes, and unlock the mysteries of the Ferryman’s caves on your quest to save the boy that creates the painted worlds. Who is he? What role will he play in the future of the kingdom?

The answers to these questions will be found along the trail of shadows.

Source: The Game Website.

114947.name: Des Zaubermeisters Erben (Midgard 4th Edition)
114947.description:
User Summary:

This PDF contains the adventure Des Zaubermeisters Erben, updated to the 4th Edition of Midgard, which originally had been released as part of Des Zaubermeisters Erben. Not included are the other two adventures that were part of the original release.

114948.description:
Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Fahrzeuge

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Ole, Marie and Zeki want to drive within Dad car to the zoo. And you can come along! While you drive around the board you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which the car is show which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the ample turn to red.

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)
114948.name: Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Fahrzeuge

114949.name: Vierzig Fässer Pfeifenkraut
114949.description:
User Summary:

This PDF contains the adventure Vierzig Fässer Pfeifenkraut, updated to the 4th Edition of Midgard, which originally had been released as part of Des Zaubermeisters Erben. Also included is the adventure Das Schandmal by Heinrich Glumpler in which the adventurers need the help of a wizard, who unfortunatley has been kidnapped and needs to be rescued first.

videogameversion.141236: UK ZX Spectrum Tape Cassette release

114950.description:
From the tape cassette inlay

1984
The British Economy with YOU at the controls! What sort of Chancellor would you make with several billion pounds to spend & five years to the next general election? Graphic Displays, Histograms & a annual performance rating are all included to show how you are doing. How many years will you last?

From the manual

1984 - GOVERNMENT MANAGEMENT
How many times have you seen politicians on TV and thought "I could do better myself!"? Well 1984, the new game from Incentive Software, challenges you to do just that! Starting with the 1982/3 figures for the British economy you take the hot seat and the responsibility of guiding the nation's affairs. You will be asked to bring your judgement to bear on the complex inter-related network of factors that govern the performance of the national economy. Can you ride out three terms of office and survive into the 21st Century? Can you weather two General Elections? Will your Britain conquer Unemployment and inflation simultaneously? Or will you be forced to resign...

114951.name: Das Schlemmermahl
114951.description:
User Summary:

This PDF contains two adventures set in KanThaiPan. Both adventures had originally been published for the 3rd Edition of Midgard and have been updated to the 4th Edition.


Das Schlemmermahl has originally been published in Mord am Schwarzdorn-See.
Der Raub der Blume has originally been published in Das Lied der Nagafrau.

114952.description:
Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Zuhause

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Ole, Marie and Zeki comes to visit you. While you going to your house you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which on the gameboard shows you which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the evening rise and you have to go to bed..

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)
114952.name: Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Zuhause

114953.name: 1994 - Ten Years After

videogameversion.141240: UK ZX Spectrum Tape Cassette release

114953.description:
User Summary

Arcade platform game. The idea is Orwell's 1984 happened, but ten years later. Now it's up to you to dodge all security measures to get to the central computer in order to switch it off and liberate the world!

114954.description:
Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Tiere

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Together with zookeeper Tim you having a nice day at the zoo.
While you going to through the zoo you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which Tim stands shows you which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the zoo closes.

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)
114954.name: Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Tiere

114955.name: Midgard: Der Kodex
114955.description:
User Summary:

For the 25th anniversary of Midgard in 2006 a leather bound deluxe version of the rules was published. The first book was labeled Der Kodex. It contains the complete contents of Midgard: Das Fantasy-Rollenspiel (4th Edition) and Das Kompendium and parts of Meister der Sphären.

114956.name: AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! for the Awesome
114956.description:
It’s the semi-sequel to our award-winning 2009 title, AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! — A Reckless Disregard for Gravity!

* 82 remastered levels from the original
* 43 brand new ones
* A new wingsuit that’s twice as fast
* Travel to Earth, Luna, and Ganymede
* PC and now Mac!

High in Earth’s stratosphere, you’ll thread a path through the rotating blades of enormous wind turbines. Elsewhere in the solar system, you’ll dodge asteroids above seas of lava, spray graffiti onto lunar government offices, and flip off Ganymede colonists, all in the name of peaceful protest.


Jump off of buildings
Create your own stunts
Impress the crowd by kissing skyscrapers
Flip people off for points


At its heart, Awesome is all about speed. With your new wingsuit, you’ll dive (and die) twice as fast, descending through the hovering cities on Earth and beyond. The fastest jumps now offer checkpoints, so if you mash your brains against extraterrestrial rock, you can rewind time and execute the perfect dodge instead.

Source: The Game Website.

114957.name: Das Bestiarium (Deluxe Version)
114957.description:
User Summary:

For the 25th anniversary of Midgard in 2006 a leather bound deluxe version of the rules was published. The second book was labeled Das Bestiarium. It contains the complete contents of Das Bestiarium, the creatures from Meister der Sphären and several more creatures taken from adventures and issues of the Midgard magazine Gildenbrief.

114958.name: Das Arkanum (Deluxe Version)
114958.description:
User Summary:

For the 25th anniversary of Midgard in 2006 a leather bound deluxe version of the rules was published. The third book was labeled Das Arkanum. It contains the complete contents of Das Arkanum and the summonings from Meister der Sphären.

114959.name: SkyDrift
114959.description:
SkyDrift is an action-heavy arcade game focusing on the ultimate racing and speed experience of flying in a light, quick, fast-paced style. Players will be taken closer than ever before to the world of adrenaline pumping sky-racing. Everybody can test and master their flying and combat skills against deadly opponents.

Source: The Developer Website.

114960.name: Association Football
114960.description:
A football board game. No publisher on the box but that hasn't stopped him from a liitle hyperbole; the most "Exciting and Thrilling Game Ever Known".

The board is a checkered surface. Dice move the football piece or the footballer pieces. That's it!

The one who scores the most goals, wins.

114961.name: Air Soccer
114961.description:
A plastic board and 4 plastic foorballers are attached to handles. They work exactly the same as a pinball machine. Both players try to swing their footballers so that they can 'kick' the ball towards the opponent's goal.

The winner is the one who scores the most goals.

videogameversion.141256: UK ZX Spectrum Tape Cassette release

114962.description:
User Summary

Space shooter. Relatively short (4 levels). Just fly around and shoot everything. And if you kill an entire wave of enemies, you get a special item.

114963.name: 1st Division Manager
114963.description:
From the manual

You have a reputation for BEING THE BEST! So good, that any club in the FIRST DIVISION will take you on as their manager. So choose your favourite team, and take them to the top.

After all, you must keep that GREAT REPUTATION! Take your team to the top in this realistic football manager simulation. Train your players to be the best!
And if they don't fulfil your expectations then sell them. This is the REAL world, so be TOUGH and get the most out of your team!

Can you win the CUP?

114964.name: 20-20 Vision

videogameversion.141259: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114964.description:
User Summary

Arcade action game where you, as soldier, have to find your way through an enormous maze build from army tents, tanks and such.

Game was released as part of the compilation "Fishpaste Volume 1"

114965.name: 20 Tons

videogameversion.141261: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114965.description:
User Summary

Boulder Dash look-a-like, made a year later by another firm. A puzzle game where you have to move boulders to get to the diamonds. View is from the side, like one of those ant aquariums: when you push a boulder in a vertical lane, it'll drop down. You can dig through dirt, but you cannot dig through the boulders, only move them - as long as there's nothing behind them.

videogameversion.141262: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114966.description:
From the instructions

As always happens, a gigantic computer in the year 2112 has gone
haywire and instead of freeing everyone from menial tasks, it has
enslaved everyone using its robots to impose its rule. It's your
job to locate the ten pieces of the Switching Code which will
deactivate the computer - your only help is a robot dog called
Poddy.

114967.name: 2 Player Soccer Squad

videogameversion.141263: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114967.description:
User Summary
Typical football (soccer) manager game with one twist: it hasa hot seat mode. Player who's turn it is not should, however, look away, as the on screen stats of the other player's team show to much info. Games are fully AI, so then it's up to the players to enjoy the match and cheer at the screen, after which a new round of buying and selling soccer players starts, and determining set-up.

114968.name: Paint Wars
114968.description:
User Summary

There are shapes on the ground which must be painted over. To make things more difficult however, tanks and planes will attempt to cover your progress. Once the shapes are covered by your own paint, you will progress to the next level. Destroy enemies by clicking on them.

114969.name: Pandemonium
114969.description:
User Summary

You gained the greatest muffin in the world, but just as you did the cave collapsed and you lost the muffin shattering it. To add to the difficulty a portal opened up and transported both you and the muffin pieces to another dimension. Now you must gather good muffins while avoiding bad muffins, traps, and falling off the edge. Do so and gain a piece of the golden muffin.

114970.name: 3DC
114970.description:
From the instructions

Stranded on the sea bed, you have to find and construct parts of a submarine which will take you to safety. Beware the dangers of the deep, and remember the old saying, "An eel is a friend for life". Only the most quick-witted and agile of mariners will avoid the grisly fate of Davy Jones' Locker.

User addition
Game was released as part of the compilation Trio (by Hit-Pak)

114971.name: 3-Deep Space

videogameversion.141270: UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114971.description:
User Summary

Basically a simple space shoot'm up game with one twist: the game came with red-blue specs. This gave the game a real 3D effect.

114972.name: Panzertroopers
114972.description:
User Summary

Stranded on planet X, apart from the rest of your squad, you must survive against an all out attack from an arachnoid species threatening the galaxy. Your extraction is ten minutes away, can you survive that long? Multiple achievements to unlock, an overheard shooter game with different weapons to choose and upgrades to take advantage of.

114973.name: Paper Pug
114973.description:
User Summary

Your dog is under attack, lead it by it's leash to avoid enemy attacks. The game is played as if sketch drawing on a piece of paper. Includes cartoon violence. Control action with the mouse.

114974.name: 3D-Interceptor

videogameversion.141273: Spanish ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114974.description:
User Summary

Simple space shoot'm up game. Viewpoint is behind your spacecraft which is flying over the planet surface. Shoot anything coming at you.

114975.name: Paper Warfare
114975.description:
User Summary

You are a guy with a jetpack and a gun. Shoot down alien ships with your ever expanding arsenal of weapons, but take care not to run out of ammo. Earn extra lives, health power ups and shields to make your task easier. Graphics are as if on sheets of paper.

114976.name: Parassault
114976.description:
User Summary

Control a boat and a parasailer. Try to avoid objects such as birds and jet skiers. Lose health when you get hit. Not a physics game, parasailer moves independent of the boat, and the boat can jump.

114977.name: Stone Wheel
114977.description:
User Summary

Stone Wheel is a platform game. The objective is to drive (with touch or accelerometer) a huge stone wheel to the exit of each level.

The game has 15 different levels.

114978.name: The Last Stand: Zombie Apocalypse
114978.description:
User Summary

The Last Stand: Zombie Apocalypse is a survival game where you have to fight hordes of zombies through different areas, each area has 8 levels and you have to fight a Boss at the end. For this purposse you have many weapons with different advantages.

114979.name: Wikitrail
114979.description:
WikiTrail is a very addictive game!!

The objective of the game is very simple. Just get to the goal as fast as you can.

When you start a new game the app will randomly assign a start page and a goal page from wikipedia. All you need to do is to try to reach the goal by simply using the links in the page.

Try it on your iPhone or iPad now!!

It is even more addictive if you compete with your friends!!

Source: The Developer Website.

114980.name: Word Slam
114980.description:
User Summary

Word Slam is a word game that you can play by yourself or head-to-head with a friend on the same device.

The goal of the game is to change the words you have using the letters that the game gives to you.

114981.name: Zombie Attack! Second Wave XL
114981.description:
"Just when you thought it was safe ZA! is back! Lovers of zombies and tower defense-style games combined have a second chance to tear into more zombies with more weapons and in more locations than ever before.

Features

7 turrets (3 new, including the Pulsewave)
New upgrades to super turrets
4 maps of varying sizes including Backyard and Trailer Park
Hordes of challenges, 5 for each map
6 zombie types (4 new, including the Hound and Cheerleader)
Instantaneous save when quitting the app
Online high scores list for each map, local lists for challenges and personal records
Automatic iPod music support (Just play your music and start the game)
3.0 USERS!! Additional iPod music playback option
IUGO high-quality and polish"

Source: The Developer Website.

114982.name: Zone Up
114982.description:
" A classic ball bouncing, brick breaking game with just one simple goal. Zone Up!".

Source: The Developer Website.

114983.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Knowledge is both powerful and deadly in Words of Power, the second Asylum Pack from the upcoming "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game.

Filled with eldritch Tomes, hidden Libraries, and the Relic Hunters determined to uncover their secrets, Words of Power heightens the different factions' quests for knowledge. While Independent agents offer their services to different groups, the Order of the Silver Twilight works in harmony to plunder the wealth of ancient journals. Research assistants at Miskatonic University delve unwittingly into danger as their study of powerful artifacts leads them across shadowy strangers, Cultists, Servitors, and monstrous black dogs.

The sixty cards in Words of Power (three copies each of twenty new cards) will promote exciting, new synergies with the Relics from the "Ancient Relics" cycle as well as with the musty, old cards lying dormant in your collection. Dark secrets in dusty tomes will determine the fate of the world. Who will find these Words of Power?
114983.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Words of Power Asylum Pack

40270.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgamefamily.10579: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

114984.name: Star Defense Mission
114984.description:
User Summary

Star Defense Mission is a sci-fi real time tower defense game. The goal of the game is to save the crystals from the invaders and to do this you have 3 kinds of turrets with lots and lots of unlockable upgrades.

Features:

3 kinds of defensive turrets with different attributes, each turret can be upgraded many times.
Besides the towers you have a nuclear bomb to create havoc among the enemy.

114985.name: Time Mysteries: Inheritance
114985.description:
"Vivien Ambrose has just discovered how to travel through time! After an evil time traveler kidnaps her father, it’s up to Vivien to follow them to the past. Using a mysterious crystal ball, visit the past, and meet Vivien’s ancestors. Collect seven magical rings to power up the crystal ball in this Hidden Object game. Set off through history in Time Mysteries: Inheritance!"

Source: The Developer Website.

114986.description:
Glenn Drover's Empires: The Age of Discovery - Plague Promo is a set of 3 new Capital Buildings that can be added to the tile mix, giving greater variety from game to game. There is one plague Capital Building for each of the three ages.

Age 1 Plague Building - Player succeeds on all discoveries in Age 1.

Age 2 Plague Building - Any colony with 3 or more population of any single color is reduced by one colonist.

Age 3 Plague Building - Player chooses one opponent colony and reduces it by 3 colonists.

The buildings are only compatible with the older "Age of Empires III" version of the game.

The deluxe edition already contains these tiles. The deluxe tiles are larger than this version, colors and material are also different.
114986.name: Glenn Drover's Empires: Age of Discovery – Plague Promo

22545.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery

114987.name: Stripe Physics
114987.description:
User Summary

Stripe Physics is a physics based puzzle game. The goal of the game is to bring the red ball onto the platform using the characteristic of the objects and the environment.

114988.name: Game & Watch Gallery 2
114988.description:
Game & Watch Gallery 2, known in Japan as Game Boy Gallery 2 (ゲームボーイギャラリー2 Gēmu Bōi Gyararii 2?), and in Australia as Game Boy Gallery 3, is the sequel to Game & Watch Gallery. It was first developed by Nintendo and originally released in 1997 in Japan, and 1998 in the US for the Game Boy and later released on November 1, 1998 for the Game Boy Color.
List of games
Parachute
Chef
Donkey Kong
Helmet
Vermin
Ball (unlockable)

Source: Wikipedia, "Game and Watch Gallery", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114989.name: Stripe Physics 2
114989.description:
"Physics based puzzle game. The objective of the game is to bring the red ball onto the platform, by using objects with different physical characteristics. 1) The physics is much faster and realistic. 2) A comepletely new Design. 3) Unlimited levels"

Source: The Developer Website.

114990.name: Game & Watch Gallery 3
114990.description:
Game & Watch Gallery 3, known in Japan as Game Boy Gallery 3 (ゲームボーイギャラリー3 Gēmu Bōi Gyararii 3?) and as Game Boy Gallery 4 in Australia, is the third installment of the Game & Watch Gallery series. It was released in 1999 for the Game Boy Color but is also compatible on the original Game Boy. It has a total of 11 games.
List of games
Egg
Green House
Turtle Bridge
Mario Bros.
Donkey Kong Jr.
Also included were several unlockable games, however these are only playable in 'classic' mode:
Judge
Flagman
Lion
Spitball Sparky
Donkey Kong II

Source: Wikipedia, "Game & Watch Gallery", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114991.description:
Everybody’s got an opinion. The Metagame gives you a chance to exercise your smartest and most ridiculous opinions on just about everything: music and movies, fine art and fashion, junk food and videogames. It’s a card game where you do what you already love to do with your friends: talk about culture. There’s not just one way to play - The Metagame comes with six unique games. Each one makes use of both types of cards in The Metagame deck:


CULTURE CARDS feature a single cultural object or icon, from the Mona Lisa to Ms. Pac-Man.
OPINION CARDS say things like “Which feels like first love?” or “Best reminder of our mortality.”


Some of the games get you debating, and some are more strategic. Some are best for a handful of players and others are designed for dozens of them.
The six games are:


Matchmakers: match your culture cards to the right opinion cards
History 101: put everything in the right chronological order
Debate Club: argue to the critics for your hilarious opinion
Head to Head: a fast-paced race to get your cards out first
Massively Multiplayer Metagame: for big parties and events
Metaquilt: a tricky combination of strategy and discussion


You don’t usually find games where players have debates like: Which is more fundamentally misunderstood - Fox News or the rainbow flag? The Metagame covers every possible kind of design, media, and art and helps you see culture in new ways. We’ve played The Metagame at hardcore tabletop game conferences and in dimly lit hipster bars. The Metagame works in just about any social setting - just pick the game variation that suits your group and situation the best.
114991.name: The Metagame

114992.name: Game & Watch Gallery 4
114992.description:
This title was released for the Game Boy Advance on October 28, 2002 with an ESRB rating of "E for everyone." It is the second title in the series to feature two-player play, provided players have two Game Boy Advances and a Game Link cable. It also marks one of the last playable appearances to date by Donkey Kong Jr. Several of the games in this title, however, previously appeared in other installments of Game & Watch Gallery. It also includes some unlockable titles, such as The Legend of Zelda series. To add further interest, this is the first game featuring Mr. Game & Watch talk. This entry in the series was titled Game & Watch Gallery Advance in Europe and Australia. For an unknown reason, The fourth game in the series got cancelled for a Japanese release. The collection has the most games of any in the series.
List of games
Fire
Boxing
Rain Shower
Mario's Cement Factory
Donkey Kong Jr.
Donkey Kong 3
Chef
Mario Bros.
Donkey Kong
Octopus
Fire Attack
Also included were several unlockable 'museum' games which could only be played in 'classic' mode:
Manhole
Tropical Fish
Mario's Bombs Away
Parachute
Bomb Sweeper
Climber
Safebuster
Life Boat
Zelda

Source: Wikipedia, "Game & Watch Gallery", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114993.name: Game & Watch Collection 2
114993.description:
Game & Watch Collection 2 is a Nintendo DS game for Club Nintendo members released on April 1, 2010. It features two single-screen Game & Watch games, Parachute and Octopus, along with an all-new dual screen game combining Parachute on the top screen with Octopus on the bottom screen. Like the previous release, the games come with both Mode A and Mode B as well as the alarm feature, which can be accessed on the start screen and the games contained in this one are exact ports of the original versions. Released on March 31st, North American Club Nintendo members can receive it in exchange for 800 coins.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game & Watch Gallery", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114994.name: White Men Can't Jump
114994.description:
White Men Can't Jump was a video game released for the Atari Jaguar in 1995, based on the movie of the same name. As in the movie, players play games of two-on-two street basketball. It came with the Team Tap Adaptor allowing four players to play in tandem.

Source: Wikipedia, "White Men Can't Jump (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114995.name: Ultra Vortek
114995.description:
Ultra Vortek is the title of an ultra violent fighting game developed by Beyond Games and published by Atari for its Atari Jaguar home console system in 1995. The game's design followed the 90's fighting game trend and attempted to capitalize on the popularity of such games. Like many ultra violent titles, the game received a "Mature" (17+) rating from the Entertainment Software Ratings Board. There is also an unreleased version for the Atari Lynx which is being finished and published by Songbird Productions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ultra Vortek", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114996.name: Penguin Overlords
114996.description:
User Summary

Turtles have taken over the world, but the penguins are here to stop them. Lead a team of up to 6 penguins against them. The five main penguins are customizable, and there are group bonuses and bombs that can be purchased as well. Your job is to build the best penguin army you can, and unleash it. You will also be responsible during the game to lay bombs, release the bonus penguin and use group bonuses. The penguins are controlled by AI.

114997.name: Trevor McFur in the Crescent Galaxy
114997.description:
Trevor McFur in the Crescent Galaxy is a side-scrolling space shooter video game for the Atari Jaguar. Aside from the pack-in game Cybermorph, it was the Jaguar's only launch title.
In the game Odd-It has conquered the Crescent Galaxy, and Trevor McFur and his partner Cutter seek to overthrow Odd-It.
Upon release the game was criticized for being a rush project that was pushed out in a last-minute effort to make at least a few games available for the Jaguar at launch.

Source: Wikipedia, "Trevor McFur in the Crescent Galaxy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114998.name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky

videogameseries.34594: The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky

videogamehonor.33986: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PC Game of the Year Nominee

114998.description:
A brand-new entry in the long-running Legend of Heroes series, this is the first game in a planned trilogy.

"In the peaceful town of Rolent of the Liberl Kingdom, a young girl named Estelle and her friend Joshua, who had been taken in by her family years earlier, prepare to take their first steps to join the legendary guild of the Bracers. Bracers are considered the peacekeepers and protectors of order that owe allegiance to no country or government. In Liberl their guild has flourished since a brief war some ten years prior after an invasion from the Erebonian Empire to the north, and their efforts have made peace a lasting prospect.

In the course of their journey to become full-fledged Bracers, Estelle and Joshua begin to see the peace threatened by a dark side of the ruling government that plots to overthrow the Liberl queen, Alicia. Together they travel the world on their quest to become Bracers and slowly unravel the truth behind the mastermind who seeks to bring war back to their borders."

Source: The Publisher Website.

114999.description:
Covel Dhanyata is not only one of the greatest summoners in all of Gaia, he is also a link with the spirit of the Fallen Angel Jigoku no Kami. Sometimes mortal, sometimes the avatar of a god, this man travels the world imposing his divine will over every supernatural creature that crosses his path.

Neutral Samael Optional Leader Mystic - Lv. 35
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP 12 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5
Summoner Level: 2
Affinity: Light, Dark, Void
Master Summoner: When Covel pays a Character’s Cost to Summon, he pays 1 Action Point less. This ability cannot reduce a Character’s Cost to Summon below 1 Action Point.
Superior Presence: For the purpose of placing a Character Covel has Summoned on the table, Covel’s Control Zone is 12 inches.
ooo - Dark Star (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. +1 Attack / +3 Damage.
oo - Empowerment (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
A Covel's Summon in his Zone of Control gain +2 Attack or +2 Defense until the end of the turn.

COVEL Jigoku no Kami’s Avatar
Optional Leader: You may choose to use this skill card when Covel is in your party. If you do, Covel gains +25 levels, has the abilities on this card, and is a Leader.
High Summoner: As the Avatar Covel’s Summoner Level increases to 3.
Undaunted: Covel doesn’t lose Life Points due to Shock Checks.
Divine Presence: During the Recovery Phase put a Bind Point on one of Covel's Summon within his Control Zone.
Immortal Avatar: When Covel’s Life Points are reduced to 0, you may destroy a Character summoned by Covel within his Control Zone instead of him. If you do Covel recovers all of his Life Points.
Enhanced Dark Star: Dark Star’s Action Point cost is reduced by one point.
ooo - Dark Sun (Magic, Attack, Reactive)
+6 Attack / +8 Damage. This Attack can only be used at the end of the Recovery Phase. Place a Devastation marker in a location that Covel has Line of Sight to that is within 20 inches of him. Once every character has completed their Activation during the Action Phase, Covel makes a single Attack against all units that are still within 4 inches of the Devastation marker. Remove the marker after the Attack.
114999.name: Anima Tactics: Covel

115000.name: SkyHammer
115000.description:
Skyhammer takes place in the mid-21st century where power-hungry corporations rule the largest cities. The player is an employee of Cytox, a Skyhammer pilot that protects the corporate investments. The player undertakes a wide variety of missions in order to prove their ability and ensure Cytox's long-term revenues.

The game's look and gameplay resemble the earlier Psygnosis PlayStation release G-Police, as the game world consists of three huge Blade Runner-esque cityscapes. The player controls a flying craft in a similar manner to Descent and has to partake in a number of missions involving objectives to combat crime in the city. Throughout the game money can be earned through successful kills, which can be spent on ship upgrades.
There are two modes of play: Mission Mode and Battle Mode. The former allows you to go on a variety of missions while upgrading your Skyhammer and claiming more territory for your corporation. The latter allows you to fight endless waves of invading corporations. Both modes provide access to three unique cities, each with its own distinct layout and challenges.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skyhammer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114501.name: Halls of Undermountain: A 4th Edition Dungeons and Dragons Supplement
114501.description:
From the product page:
Beneath the streets of Waterdeep, a sinister dungeon awaits adventurers brave enough to face its perils. Created ages ago by the wizard Halaster, the sprawling dungeon is a lair for terrible monsters and ruthless villains. In the dark chambers, they hunger for victims and plot the downfall of those who dwell on the streets above. Who will unravel the twisting labyrinth to reveal its secrets, claim its treasures, and stop the foul machinations of the dungeon’s denizens?
Halls of Undermountain is a 96-page hardcover book that presents a ready-to use dungeon detailing over eighty locations. The adventure offers a way for Dungeon Masters participating in the recent D&D Encounters season, The Elder Elemental Eye, to extend the adventure. In addition, this book provides all the ingredients to run a classic dungeon delve, including enticing treasures, deadly traps, a wide assortment of monsters, and two double-sided full-color poster maps.

114502.name: The Urban Underdark
114502.description:
From the publisher:
Illustrated cardstock terrain tiles for use with the Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game.

This roleplaying game accessory gives Dungeon Masters an easy and inexpensive way to include great-looking terrain in their games. This set provides ready-to-use, configurable tiles with which to build exciting encounter locations.

114503.name: Asuka 120% Limited BURNING Fest.
114503.description:
User Summary

Asuka 120% Limited BURNING Fest. is an all-girl fighting game that centers around an annual fighting tournament held by an all girl school and is the seventh game in the series.

This installment features 15 characters (some of which are male), each representing their respective school club for dominance at the yearly "Mega Fight".

boardgamehonor.20967: 2011 Origins Awards Best Miniatures Rules or Expansion Nominee

114504.description:
Carnevale is a brand new miniature skirmish game, set in a twisted city of Venice in 1795. These are 28mm metal models for painters and players alike. The game has a simple game system, but enough tactical depth to please many wargamers.

This is the year 1795. After a magical cataclysm that has changed Europe and the world as we know it, the city of Venice is under the effects of the Rent in the Sky. For the first time in history, magic is walking freely on its streets, ancient monsters have awakened from their submarine slumber and found their way towards the canals of this city, a decadent nobility has discovered new ways of depravity in senseless violence, and the citizens of Venice do the best they can to survive under the protection of the Guild of thieves.
114504.name: Carnevale

114506.description:
Ludo Funfair. Ludo variant with a funfair theme.
Box content
Electronic rotating gameboard
4 slides in 4 colors
4 x 3 pawns
1 die

Goal of the game
The 1st player to bring his pawn from the slide to the center of the board is the winner.

In his turn the player rolls a die and depending on the color picks an action.
White: choose an action except opening a purple gate
Orange, pink or dark blue: open a gate of the same color in one direction to send one pawn a section ahead or backwards
Purple: use the slide to remove one pawn from the board
114506.name: Mens erger je niet! Kermis

114507.name: Das Segler-Spiel
114507.description:
Objective:
be the first to pass finish line
- acting/moving by turn/ -
1. prepare race circuit - place buoys no 1,2,3 & target area
2. your boat has to sail past on the larboard side - counterclockwise
3. arrange your sails & spinnaker during the race to optimize your speed - allowed moves: adjacent areas
4. follow instructions of weather/event cards
options:
define fixed wind direction or
wind blows out of different directions at the same time

content: 1 board, 1 wind-wheel, 1 needle (marker), 6 yachts, 6 large markers (show set sails), 6 small markers ( show set spinnaker), 3 black markers (show defect sails), 6 speed charts, 126 weather/event cards

114508.description:
Poepie Knor is a game in which 2-4 player try to rescue their piglets from his dirt bath. But if you hear a fart your piglets sinks deeper in the mud.

Goal of the game:
Be the 1st player to gather 4 cards (1 to 4) so your piglet gets out of his mud bath.

Each player gets a piglet and a bath. On his move he turns the big pig (spinner), depending on the sound the pig makes the player takes an action:
- the pig grunts. The player indicated by the pigs nose takes a card
- the pig honks. The 1st player to press the button on the pigs back takes a card
- the pig whistles. The player indicated by the pigs nose steals a card from another player
- the pig farts. The player indicated by the pigs nose places a card from his bath next to the board.

The 1st player to first collect a set (1-4) in the correct order is the winner.
114508.name: Poepie Knor

114509.name: Die Meister von Feuer und Stein

rpgissuearticle.98448: Die Meister von Feuer und Stein - Ein Zwergenquellenbuch

114509.description:
From the back of the book:

Dieses Quellenbuch enthält Hintergrundmaterial zu den Zwergen Midgards. Neben der Beschreibung ihrer Sagenwelt und ihrer Geschichte, ihrer Lebensweise und ihres Glaubens bietet das Buch ein Bestiarium, Informationen über Runenmeister und ihre Zauberkünste sowie eine Vielfalt magischer Artefakte aus Zwergenhand.


Translation:

This source book contains background material about the dwarfs of Midgard. Besides the description of their legends and their history, their lifestyle and their beliefs, the book offers a bestiary, information about rune masters and their magic arts and a variety of magical artifacts made from dwarven hands.

114510.name: Die Meister von Feuer und Stein: Ergänzungsband

rpgissuearticle.98448: Die Meister von Feuer und Stein - Ein Zwergenquellenbuch

114510.description:
User Summary:

This book adds some additional information about the dwarves of Midgard, that didn't fit in the main publication Die Meister von Feuer und Stein. It contains information about runes and their creation, dwarven metal art, music and dances, language und writing of the dwarves.

114511.name: Nihavand: Die Perle Arans
114511.description:
From the back of the book:

Dieses Quellenbuch erweckt das Land Aran und seine Menschen zum Leben. Eine kompakte Landeskunde (Land und Leute, Gesellschaft und Sitten, Wirtschaft und Verkehr, Kultur, Kunst und Wissenschaft, Religion) liefert die wesentlichen Informationen, während die farbigen Details, die den Alltag der Araner lebendig werden lassen, in Form einer ausführlichen Beschreibung der Hafenstadt Nihavand geliefert werden. Zur Abrundung führen zwei kurze locker zusammenhängende Abenteuer um eine Hochzeit und einen Todesfall die Spieler in das Brauchtum der Einheimischen ein und lassen sie schnell aranische Freunde und Gönner finden.


Translation:

This source book awakes the country of Aran and its people to life. A compact geography (country and its people, society and customs, economy and transport, culture, art and science, religion) provides the essential information, while the colorful details that make the everyday life of the Aran coming alive, are delivered in the form of a detailed description of the port city Nihavand. To round this up two loosely connected short adventures, one for a wedding and a death case, introduce the players to the traditions of the locals and let them find Aranese friends and patrons soon.

114512.name: Thalassa und der Bettlerkönig
114512.description:
From the back of the book:

Thalassa, die Perle des Imperiums, so wurde die Hauptstadt der Seemeister genannt, und keine andere Metropole auf Midgard konnte und kann es an Pracht und Herrlichkeit mit ihr aufnehmen. Doch mit ihren Herren ging auch Thalassa im Krieg der Magier unter und wurde ein Opfer der Wut von Dämonen und des Tobens der Elemente.

Heute leben wieder Menschen in Thalassa, dem Schandfleck Chryseias, wie die Stadt jetzt genannt wird. Ihre Bewohner seien nichts als unehrliches Volk, das andernorts nicht geduldet wird, und selbst der geheimnisvolle Herrscher der Stadt sei nur ein Bettlerkönig.

Doch täuschen sich die Spötter, doch obwohl Thalassa eine Zuflucht für Bettler, Schmuggler und Diebe ist, gibt es auch ganz normale Fischer, Händler und Handwerker, und der unsichtbare Bettlerkönig sorgt aus dem Hintergrund für Ordnung. Hinter dem Anschein von Normalität lauern aber auch dunkle Geheimnisse. Zu Recht für ihre Schreckenstaten verbannte Zauberer, Adlige und Anhänger finsterer Mächte finden hier Asyl. Furchtbare Zauber und Dämonen aus der Zeit der Seemeister sind noch immer in den Ruinen aktiv. Und hinter dem Mysterium des Bettlerkönigs stecken der Fluch einer Göttin und das Wirken weitaus älterer Mächte. All das kann aber nicht die Schatzsucher abschrecken, die für die verlockende Aussicht auf Reichtümer und einzigartige Artefakte der Seemeister jedes Risiko in Kauf nehmen.

Dieses Buch erweckt die Stadt des Bettlerkönigs zum Leben, gibt einen Überblick über die Geschichte und die gegenwärtige Situation Thalassas und beschreibt mit der Nyktoros-Halbinsel auch das Umland der Stadt. Eine Farbkarte des südlichen Chryseias liegt bei.


Translation:

Thalassa, the pearl of the empire, such the capital of Seemeister was called, and no other city on Midgard could and can match the splendor and glory of her. But with their masters Thalassa passed away in the war of magicians and became a victim of the fury of demons and the raging of the elements.

Today again people live in Thalassa, the eyesore of Chryseia, as the city is now called. Its inhabitants are nothing but dishonest people that will not be tolerated elsewhere, and even the mysterious ruler of the city is only a beggar king.

But those who scoff are deceiving themself, while Thalassa still is a refuge for beggars, smugglers and thieves, there are also quite normal fishermen, merchants and craftsmen, and the invisible beggar king provides the background for order. Lurking behind the appearance of normalcy, also dark secrets lurk. And rightly so for their atrocities exiled magician, nobles and followers of dark powers find asylum here. Fearsome magic and demons from the time of the Seemeisters are still active in the ruins. And behind the mystery of the beggar king the curse of a goddess and much older forces are at work. All this may not deter the treasure hunters who accept every risk to the tantalizing prospect of riches and the unique artifacts of the Seemeisters.

This book brings to life the city of the beggar king, an overview of the history and current situation of Thalassa and describes with the Nyktoros Peninsula the surrounding areas of the city. A color map of southern Chryseia is included.

114514.name: Das Beste aus Drache
114514.description:
(User summary)

A compilation of articles originally published in the first seven issues of Drache.

Unlike the American issues of Best of The Dragon, this magazine was a free giveaway available from retailers.

114515.description:
The monster that responds to the name of Adolf Brunner, known as "Loki" among members of Les Jaeger, is a cruel supernatural scientist who has corrupted his own body in exchange for power. He has earned the position of captain of the special forces of the Azur Alliance with his intelligence, cruelty and gift to manipulate the souls of his enemies. With little loyalty other than to serve his own interests and curiosity to experiment, Adolf Brunner is a truly repulsive creature.

Dark Azur Alliance Mystic/Prowler - Lv. 45
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP 13 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/4
Innate Abilities: Initiative
False Demise: If Adolf loses all of his Life Points, on a roll of 6+ place a marker at his current location. At the beginning of the next Turn place Adolf back on the board within 4 inches of the marker with 1 LP. You cannot activate this ability if it has already been used or if it is the last Turn of the game.
oo - Snake Blood (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Adolf's Control Zone suffers Poison Lv. 2. Effect 16.
oo - Obscuritas (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Adolf's Control Zone suffers Blind lv. 2. Effect 16.
oo - Essence of Corruption (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Adolf's Control Zone suffers 4 points of Damage. Effect 15.
A part of Team Puppet Master along with Frey and Freya
114515.name: Anima Tactics: Adolf Brunner

114516.description:
Adolf Brunner’s twin daughters, Frey and Freya have been raised as living weapons whose sole purpose is destroying Adolf’s enemies. Inheriting bestial spirit power from their mother Tuan Dalyr and modified with enhanced physical abilities due to their father’s experiments, they are terrifyingly inhuman predators. Frey and Freya aren’t driven by evil and cruelty, sadly depravity and death is all they have ever known.

Dark Azur Alliance Prowler - Lv. 40
At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP: 12 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/4
Innate abilities: Open Movement
Unbound: At the end of the Maintenance phase roll a dice.
On 6+, Frey suffers Berserk Lvl 1.
