Mit dem aus Sturm über Mokattam bekannten Magier Nasser Bedr’ussuman gibt es ein fulminantes Wiedersehen.


Translation:

Myrkgard, the sphere of the dark Seemeisters, threatens its sister world, Midgard, and the adventurers are the link. A legendary vessel that can travel through the magical space is hidden in a forgotten dark dwarven colony and will bring the adventurers to Myrkgard. Who always wanted to know what the legendary flight grave of the Tancredi is (mentioned in The Winged Ring), will get answers to all questions. With the magician Nasser Bedr'ussuman, known from Sturm über Mokattam, there is a brilliant reunion.

114618.name: Die schwarze Sphäre
114618.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dieses Abenteuer knüpft direkt an das Ende von Das Graue Konzil an. Auch auf Myrkgard gibt es ein Thalassa, doch diese Stadt ist keine Ruine, sondern die Perle des Valianischen Imperiums und Wohnsitz zahlreicher dunkler Seemeister. Hier müssen die Abenteurer sich vor allerlei Nachstellungen hüten, blutige und atemberaubende Spiele in Arena und Circus bestehen und zum Schluss die Geheimnisse des göttlichen Rhadamanthus überleben. Dann steht der Rückkehr nach Midgard nichts mehr im Wege. Das Heft enthält Spielregeln für eine Seeschlacht und ein Wagenrennen sowie eine Beschreibung von ganz Myrkgard.


Translation:

This adventure is directly linked to the end of Das Graue Konzil. On Myrkgard there is also a Thalassa, but this city is not ruins, but the pearl of the Valian empire and home to many dark Seemeisters. Here the adventurers must beware of all kinds of persecution, and there are bloody amazing games in the Arena and Circus to master and in the end, the secrets of the divine Rhadamanthus to survive. Then nothing stands in the way of a return to Midgard. The booklet contains rules for a naval battle and chariot race, and a description of all of Myrkgard.

114619.name: Der Weg nach Vanasfarne
114619.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Der Fund eines geweihten Kelches lässt die Abenteurer die Reise zum altehrwürdigen Kloster Vanasfarne antreten. Auf dem Weg sind Abenteuer im winterlichen Artross-Gebirge mit Orcs, im sommerlichen Wald von Escavalon gegen Druidenmagie und an der herbstlichen See in einer Geisterstadt zu bestehen. Die drei Teilabenteuer (Orcwinter, Druidenmond, Unheilnebel) können auch voneinander losgelöst gespielt werden.


Translation:

The discovery of a sacred chalice lets the adventurers travel to the ancient monastery Vanasfarne. On the way are adventures in the wintry Artross mountains with orcs, in the summer Forest of Escavalon against druid magic and at the autumnal sea in a ghost town to master. The three adventure parts (Orcwinter, Druidmoon, Evil Fog) can also be played separately from each other.

114620.name: Der Wilde König
114620.description:
User Summary:

This adventure book contains two adventures:


Der Wilde König - The wild King
Gefährliche Träume - Dangerous Dreams

114621.name: Was Fürsten wollen
114621.description:
From the back of the book:

Nach Einbruch der Dunkelheit ist es in Moravod nicht geheuer. Vampire streifen auf der Suche nach Opfern durch die Städte. In den Wäldern gehen Werwölfe auf die Jagd, und übellaunige Naturgeister treiben ihren Schabernack mit arglosen Wanderern. Wer bei Verstand ist, der bleibt nach Sonnenuntergang in der Sicherheit der Weiler, Landgasthöfe und Schlösser, wo Feuer und Schutzzauber die Mächte der Finsternis im Zaum halten.

So war es schon immer, doch jetzt hat sich Moravod verändert - und nicht zum Besseren! Vor ein paar Jahren haben tapfere Abenteuer das Land aus großer Gefahr errettet und den Schwarzen Drachen bezwungen. Seither hört man aber immer öfter, dass die guten Geister den Moraven ihren Schutz verweigern. Geweihte Waffen und Wundertaten versagen im Kampf gegen finstere Mächte, und in jüngster Zeit sollen sich sogar Vampire frech im vollen Licht der Sonne gezeigt haben! Was soll nur aus den Menschen werden, wenn sie selbst am helllichten Tag nicht mehr vor dem Bösen sicher sind?

Was Fürsten wollen verwickelt die Abenteurer in die Pläne von Vampirfürsten, die um mehr Macht ringen. Aber auch die Fürsten der Menschen verfolgen ihre eigenen Interessen. Der Großfürst von Geltin möchte, dass die Ursache für das sein Reich bedrohende Unheil gefunden wird. Sein Bruder zählt auf die Mithilfe der Abenteurer beim Werben um eine junge Frau aus gutem Hause. Schließlich wartet noch das Rätsel der blauen Sphäre, die den Erzvampir Mizquitotl umfängt, auf seine Lösung. Und wenn die Abenteurer sich nicht durch den Fanatismus der moravischen Hexenjäger, die blitzenden Klingen des fahrenden Volkes und die Zerstreutheit des Geltiner Hofmagiers beirren lassen, erkennen sie zum Schluss, dass alles mit allem zusammenhängt.
Dieses Heft enthält ein Rollenspiel-Abenteuer, das die Geschichte vom Land, das nicht sein darf einleitet, sowie eine ausführliche Stadtbeschreibung von Geltin.


Translation:

After dark it makes you feel uncomfortable in Moravod. Vampires roam the cities in search of victims. Werewolves hunt in the woods, and ill-tempered nature spirits drive their tricks on unsuspecting hikers. Who is in his right mind, remains after sunset in the safety of hamlets, country inns and castles, and where fire and protection spells keep the forces of darkness in check.

So it has always been, but now Moravod has changed - and not for the better! A few years ago brave adventures have saved the country from a great danger, and defeated the Black Dragon. Since then you can hear that the good spirits refuse to the Morave their protection more and more. Sanctified weapons and miracles fail in the struggle against dark forces, and in recent times even vampires have been naughtly shown themself in the full light of the sun! What will become of the people, if they even in broad daylight are no longer safe of the bad guys?

What princes want involves the adventurers in the plans of vampire princes, who struggle for more power. And the princes of the people pursue their own interests, too. The Grand Duke of Geltin want the cause of the disaster threatening his kingdom to be found. His brother is counting on the help of the adventurers in attracting a young woman from a good family. Finally, the mystery of the blue sphere that surrounds the Erzvampir Mizquitotl waits on its solution. And if the adventurers do not leave by the fanaticism of the Moravian witch hunters, the flashing blade of moving people and put off the absentmindedness of Geltiners court magician, they finally realize that everything is interconnected.
This booklet contains a role-playing adventure that introduces the story of the country that may not be, and a detailed description of Geltin city.

114628.name: Chip
114628.description:
The game consists of 60 numbered color disks (five colors, numbers 1-6, two of each number in each color). 25 of these are shuffled and placed face-up on the table in a 5x5 grid. A pawn is placed on the chip in the center.
The players now take turns rolling a 1/2/3 die and moving the pawn the respective distance over the grid (orthogonally only).At the end of their move, they can pick up the chip they are standing on and replace it by a new one.
The game continues until there are no replacement chips left. Then the players count their score: Each set of three chips in three different colors with the same number and each set of three with a sequence of consecutive numbers (i.e. 3,4,5) counts as many points as the sum of the numbers. A set of only one color counts double. The player with the highest score wins.

114629.name: The Five Deadly Shadows

rpgseries.39617: ADAP - Living Forgotten Realms Adapted Adventures

114629.description:
From the first page of the adventure:

The Shou town of Kudoku is in despair. Its magistrate once embodied a set of principles that guided the village, but he was murdered by assassins known as the Five Deadly Shadows. The principles have been corrupted and now protect the assassins. Can you recover the principles and best prevent the town’s destruction? A Living Forgotten Realms adapted adventure set in the Dragon Coast for Adventure Level 8 (recommended character levels 7 to 9 – characters below this level may find it too difficult and characters above this level may find it lacks challenge). This adventure is found in Issue 195 of Dungeon online, part of D&D Insider.
Dungeon issues may be found on the Wizards of the Coast website (http://wizards.com/dnd). At least one person at the table (either a player or the DM) must have an active subscription to D&D Insider. We recommend that you allow at least 8 hours of playing time to complete this adventure (the equivalent of a two-round standard LFR adventure).

114630.name: Railway Stations
114630.description:
Party game. Each guest (or a team if more thasn eight want to play) is given a card with cryptic clues to the names of railway stations. For example;

They Man the Ship - the correct answer is Crewe

The first person or team to hand in a correct list of 24 stations, wins. Or the guest with the most answers once the host calls time, wins.

One interesting point. The illustration on the player cards shows a train with a striking similarity to a Thomas the Tank Engine illustration. Thomas debuted in 1946, 11 years after this game went on sale. Was this game an inspiration? It might have been.

114631.name: The Tangled Skein of Destiny

rpgseries.39645: EPIC - Living Forgotten Realms Epic Campaign Adventures

114631.description:
From the first page of the adventure:

A trail of assassination and devastation leads to Lolth’s throne. The path to the Queen of Spiders is treacherous and the soul of many a brave hero is trapped alongside the demons ensnared in her webs. Can you weave your way through the Demonweb to untangle the truth? A three-round Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in the Demonweb for 23rd level characters. This adventure is a direct sequel to EPIC3-2 Cracks in the Crimson Cage and the conclusion to the first season of the Epic Campaign.
This is a three-round adventure. We recommend that you allow a minimum of 12-15 hours of playing time.

114632.name: Aggravating Rates
114632.description:
Party game.

Each guest, or team of guests, is given a card with 36 clues to words that end in 'rate'. For example, 'An Aggravating Rate' would be a clue to 'Exasperate'.

First to hand in 36 correct answers or, if the host calls time, the individual or team that has the most correct answers by that time, wins.

114633.name: Cryptic Counsels
114633.description:
Party game.

Each guest (or team) is given a card with 21 well-known proverbs, but the words, in order, have been jumbled up.
For example;

EERHTSINYAMAPLISWITXTEHTUCPADNHTEIPL

WOULD BE

THERE IS MANY A SLIP TWIXT THE CUP AND THE LIP

Imagine doing that after a couple of drinks!

The team or guest to get them all correct, wins. Or the ones with the most correct answers when the host calls time, win.

Part of the company's Puzzling Pastimes Series

114634.name: Jumbles
114634.description:
Party game.

Each guest or team are given a card with clues to 13 sets of words. Each set has three answers and they are all anagrams of each other.

Their example is curious;

Highest Point is Acme
Statt is Mace
Approached is Came

It is curious because I always thought Acme was the company that provided the Coyote in his attemps to catch the Roadrunner.
And as for Statt, I have never heard that word before.

The first guest or team to hand in 13 correct answers, wins. Or the guest or team win, who have the most correct answers when the host calls time.

114635.name: Haymaker! (Issue 57 - 2011)
114635.description:
User Summary

In this issue: An Extra Segment, A Closer Look, Ad Nauseum, Around the World in 6,912,000 Segments, Power Point, Surbrook’s Stuff!, & Soliloquies.

114636.name: Crazy Geography
114636.description:
Party game for four to eight individual guests or teams.

The participants are given a card with 23 cryptic clues to names with a geographical link. For example;

A cold country near to the Equator would be CHILI

The guest or team that gets them all correct first, wins. Or the guest or team win, that have the most correct answers when the host calls time

114637.name: Tons of Geography
114637.description:
Party game for 4 to 8 individuals or teams.

Each participant is given a card with 27 clues to British towns ending in 'ton'. For example;

Where the Rheumatic and Gouty seek relief, would be Buxton.

The guest or team that gets them all correct first, wins. Or the guest or team win, that have the most correct answers when the host calls time.

114638.name: Federation 2
114638.description:
Federation 2 was launched in January 1986 on the UK Compunet network and was the first online game in the world to be written as a commercial game. It was the first non-RPG/Adventure online game, and is the oldest continuously available online game.

Source: The Game Website.

Live the life of a Galactic trader in Federation DataSpace. The markets and exchanges await you. Haul cargo from planet to planet, become a trusted courier, buy and sell goods, trade in futures contracts, and build factories to produce your own goods. Then advance to own shares in other players' companies, and build your very own planet. Have you got what it takes to succeed in the economic playground of the future?

Source: The Game Website.

114639.name: Jack Keane
114639.description:
Struggling for money in colonial England, Jack Keane accepts a charter to take a British secret agent to mysterious Tooth Island. But Jack's ship crashes against the island's cliffs and his charge quickly becomes a jungle monster's meal. As Jack struggles to survive, he begins to unravel a mystery out of his distant past. Features dozens of characters and more than 250 found objects.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jack Keane (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114659.name: Asuka 120% BURNING Fest.
114659.description:
User Summary

Asuka 120% BURNING Fest. is the first game in the Asuka 120% series of Japanese Bishojo fighting games.

The game features a cast of six female characters to choose from, each a member of a different school club. The special moves and abilities for each character is attached to the club that they are affiliated with.

The game has many features which were original for the time of its release including the ability to jump high and hop, counter attacks from blocking, easy to input special move commands, and others.

114660.name: Asuka 120% BURNING Fest. Excellent
114660.description:
User Summary

Asuka 120% BURNING Fest. Excellent is the second game in the Asuka 120% series of Japanese Bishojo fighting games.

This version features enhanced visuals and sound thanks to the use of the FM Towns CD-Rom drive and features an improved Adventure mode.

The fighter roster remained unchanged for this version.

114661.name: Asuka 120% Maxima BURNING Fest.
114661.description:
User Summary

Asuka 120% BURNING Fest. Maxima is the third game in the Asuka 120% series of Japanese Bishojo fighting games.

This version added four additional characters to the game: Cathy Wild (Pro-Wrestling Club), Karina Toyota (Biology Club), Kiyoko Mitarai (Softball Club), and Nana Owada (Japanese Dance Club).

The game also had better collisions and the ability to use the Arcade Card for better loading times and better sound.

114662.name: Asuka 120% Special BURNING Fest.

videogameversion.140763: JP PlayStation Network PSOne Classics version

114662.description:
User Summary

Asuka 120% Special BURNING Fest. is the fourth game in the Asuka 120% series of Japanese Bishojo fighting games.

This game features one additional character: Shinobu Kawasaki (a gang leader from another school). In addition to this, the game has more moves and combos, and a special gauge for super combos.

114663.name: Zagorgs
114663.description:
Answering to a distress call, teams of space marines descend into a mine on another planet. There, they must rescue captured miners, avoid the mysterious Shanalgar and fight a terrible alien species of unknown origin: the Zagorgs.

Each player controls a team of two marines, a Shanalgar "knight" and, to hinder the other players, a constantly renewed supply of Zagorgs. The players score points by rescuing miners, healing other players' wounded marines and, of course, killing Zagorgs. The game ends when the last miner is safe.

114664.name: Bon Voyage
114664.description: The object of the game is to be the first player to travel around the world! To do this you must journey through eight colour-coded areas of the world and collect at least one Bon Voyage card from each area. The first player to accumulate at least 40,000 kilometres on Bon Voyage cards, from all 8 areas, returns home to win the game.

114666.name: Milton Keynes Go
114666.description:
A variant board for the classical game Go, based on a street map of Milton Keynes. Milton Keynes has approximately grid-style plan, but the boundaries of the map are irregular, and there are four places where two "parallel" streets intersect.

Other rules are as in normal Go. However, the tactical properties of the irregular boundary majorly affect gameplay: for example, there are places where it is possible to create an eye by playing only one stone. Also, because the Milton Keynes board (77 points) is much smaller than even the reduced-size 13×13 Go board (169 points), the game is much shorter.

This game was created as a side event at the 2001 Milton Keynes Go Tournament, and subsequently made available on the Web as print-and-play.

114667.description: Players control one of the great scientists during the 17th century Scientific Revolution in Europe. Use your limited time and energy to make discoveries, test hypotheses, publish papers, correspond with other famous scientists, hire assistants into your laboratory and network with other people who can help your progress. Discoveries follow historical tech trees in the key sciences of the age: Astronomy, Mathematics, Physics, Biology and Chemistry. The scientist who accumulates the most prestige will be appointed the first President of the Royal Society.
114667.name: The New Science

114668.description:
Afrique du Nord 1955-1961 (North Africa 1955-1961) is an expansion, only available in French, for En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine, fifth module of the En Pointe Toujours! series, published with Vae Victis 80. It covers the Algeria War (1955-1960), the 1956 Suez crisis and the Bizerte disengagement in 1961.

This DTP expansion includes one sheet with counters and terrains, historical notes, sixteen scenarios and version 5.2 of the rules.
114668.name: En Pointe Toujours!: Afrique du Nord 1955-1961

36665.name: En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine

114669.name: 101-in-1 Explosive Megamix
114669.description:
101-in-1 Explosive Megamix is a video game developed by Nordcurrent and published by Atlus for the Nintendo DS. It was first released in Europe on November 28, 2008 and features 10 hours worth of mini-games. A version for the WiiWare service was released on September 22, 2011 in Europe and on October 13, 2011 in North America.

Players can use the stylus and touch screen to test their reflexes in action mini-games like racing and skydiving, take on sporting events such as basketball, curling, and archery, strategize with tank and space combat games, or play match three, Sudoku, and jigsaw puzzles. Gamers who set high scores earn gold coins that can be used to unlock other activities, and those looking for multiplayer action take on friends in multi-card wireless play.

Source: Wikipedia, "101-in-1 Explosive Megamix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

114670.name: Absolute Baseball
114670.description:
User Summary

Released for DSiWare, Absolute Baseball is a management sim giving players a baseball team to guide through the ranks to the championship. The player will earn points from their team playing games they can spend to increase the skills of their team.

114671.name: Fruits and Vegetables
114671.description:
Party game for up to 8 individuals or teams.

Each guest or team are given a card with 24 cryptic clues on it. As they enjoy the evening, they try to work out the answers. Example question;

Clue: Half a figure
Answer: Fig

The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114672.name: Tally Ho!
114672.description:
Described as 'An Indoor Cub Hunt'.

Party game for up to 8 guests or teams.

Games instructions: Here is a novel form of "CUBBING". The answer to each of the following questions is one word containing the 3 letters C U B. The numbers at the side of each question indicate the amount of letters in the word forming the correct answer. Note: the letters C U B may occur in any order in the answer.

Each participant is given a card with 24 questions. Example:

Question: Bludgeon (4)
Answer: Club

The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114673.name: My Odd Grocery Order
114673.description:
Party game for up to eight indivivuals or teams.

The varous item of the order are suggested by this example:

Clue: An old sailor
Answer: Salt

Each participant is given a card with 24 such clues. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114674.name: Hidden Birds
114674.description:
Party game for up to 10 guests or teams.

The solution to each question is name of a well-known bird. Example:

Question: To go about selling
Answer: Hawk

Each participant receives a card with 30 questions and should try to solve them during the evening. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114675.name: Game Dressing
114675.description:
Party game for up to 10 guests or teams.

Each participant is given a card with 24 clues to 24 different items of clothing. The clues can be quite cryptic so the game would have been better played as a team game. Several brains are usually better than just one. Example clue:

Clue: A bay
Answer: Cardigan
(Cardigan Bay is a well known area of Wales)

The answer to each clue is an article or wearing apparel. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114677.name: Well-Known Fruit and Vegetables
114677.description:
Party game for up to 10 individuals or teams.

The answers, given correctly, supply the name of a well-known fruit or vegetable. Example:

Clue: Seen in a village, and relatives
Answer: Pumpkin
(You have to know that, back then, before water mains were fitted, rural villages had to use a village pump everyday, to get their water)

The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114678.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The rising sun turns red a hundred thousand spearpoints. Its rays burnish the armour of commanders hungry for conflict. And yet Man does not stand alone in his war against the darkness. The proud warhosts of the elder races stride out from their ancient realms, resplendent and majestic. Each warrior is the equal of a dozen lesser mortals, and yet none expect to see the dawn.
–Warhammer, "War Unending"

The first Battle Pack in "The Bloodquest Cycle" for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, Rising Dawn gives players exciting new reasons to play and attempt quests. Its 60 new cards (three copies each of 20 different cards) shake the balance of power between the races of the Old World and open new strategies.

The High Elves gain inspiration from a powerful legend, Dwarfs gain strength from the fires of their ancient grudges, Orc hordes rise in unending waves, knights of the Empire ride to defend its borders, the Dark Elves profit from their opponents' suffering, and the warriors of Chaos strew devastation in their wake.

Across the field of battle, armies mass, ready to make war in the Rising Dawn, a game-changing Battle Pack for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game.
114678.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Rising Dawn

114679.name: Find the Bird
114679.description:
Party game for up to 8 individuals or teams.

Each participant gets a card with 32 clues. The correct answers are well-known birds. Example:

Clue: A cricketing term
Answer: Duck
(For those of you who don't play or watch cricket, a Duck is the term for a player who loses his wicket without scoring a run).

During the evening, players should complete the card with as many correct answers or guesses as they can. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

114680.name: A Horticultural Hotch-Potch
114680.description:
Party game for up to 8 individuals or teams.

Each player is given a card with 23 clues, whose answer will be a Fruit, Flower, Tree, Vegetable or Herb. Example;

Clue: Two
Answer: Pear
Some of the clues are quite cryptic.

During the evening guests are encouraged to complete their card whils mingling with other guests. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

114681.name: Space Gothic: Spielleiterschirm
114681.description:
user summary

The Gamemaster Screen for Space Gothic.

With all the usefull tables and overview of the rules.

114682.name: Dead Horde
114682.description:
User Summary

A virus has spread around the world and infected zombies are all around. As one of the survivors you and your comrade have to fight of wave of wave of zombies.

This game is a zombie shooter similar to games like Alien Swarm or Bunch of Heroes where the main focus is on cooperative gameplay.

114683.name: A-10 Thunderbolt

videogameversion.140789: UK ZX Spectrum Tape Cassette release

114683.description:
User Summary

Simple shooter, viewed from the top. Manoeuvring a plane (apparently the A-10) while shooting up everything. 1 player, 3 lives per game.

114684.description:
(Description from thegamecrafter.com)

A new land has been discovered. As a mighty king, you have a grand opportunity to expand your empire by building new villages here. Unfortunately, many of your fellow rulers also hope to stake their claim in this new world. Whose villages will stand, and whose will fall?

Each card has a gold value, and your goal is to earn 100 gold pieces across multiple rounds by building villages. Do this by collecting three unit cards of the same color and laying them down. If an enemy puts down a card you'd like to have, it's time for battle! Send out your village's finest hero or hire one in secret by playing it face-down from your hand, and your opponent will do the same. Play the stronger card, and you'll be able to take a prisoner from your enemy's village and make it part of your own.

However, it's not enough to simply send your most powerful units to attack neighboring kingdoms. Each unit has its own winning strategies: knights excel at defense, the wizard's power falters only when facing enemies of the same color, the dragon's strength increases with each enemy he defeats, and heroes become much stronger when you're in last place. These are only a few of the 15 different unit types you'll command. With the right combination of luck and skill, you'll always come out on top.

War is one way to expand your empire, but it is certainly not the only way. Perhaps you'd like to avoid conflict altogether. Take on the role of a benevolent king who gives freely to other players, and you'll win bonus gold for being the first to empty their hand and end the round. However you choose to play, there are strategic choices to be made. How will you rule?
114684.name: Villages

114685.name: Aahku al Rescate

videogameversion.140792: Spanish/ UK ZX Spectrum tape cassette release

114685.description:
From the game manual
THE PLOT:

Grognors always have been peaceful creatures. Although their fangs and their pointed ears, they always have been beloved by Green Land people. They only can speak three words, they like to eat "serranito" (typical Andalusian sandwich) and their hobbit is to bit pieces of plaster in a compulsively way. They are quiet and harmless by nature and when they
fall in love, it's forever. But Grognors have got enemies too...the awful "Stick-o-man", the infamous "Maximus Krab" and, the worst of all of them, the unpredictable "Littliwormy" are gathering to tease Aahku (our favourite grognor), caging
his girlfriend Aljka. Can you help to our hero?

Just one more thing. Did I tell you that grognors can't swim?

User Summary
Apparently even to this day, there are still new games being released for platforms like the ZX Spectrum. Game produced under Creative Commons

114686.description:
Sparro is an adaptation of the game Captain's Mistress (think Connect Four) for the Shibumi game platform. It differs from the original in that the goal is to be the first to get three in a row rather than four and the board wraps around the Shibumi pyramid. It is about as simple as it gets but has more depth than tic tac toe. Sparro is quick to play, has a surprise or two now and then, and is fun.

Sparro is played on the four faces of the three lower levels of the Shibumi pyramid. (There is no crow's nest.) To set up the board, create a 2x2 pyramid using five white marbles in the center of the 4x4 base. This pyramid will support the placing of marbles on the outer faces.

One player uses twelve red mistress marbles and the other uses twelve black pirate marbles.

Red starts and places a marble on any empty space. Players then take turns playing a marble on any empty space or 2x2 platform.

The first to get three in a row wins the sparring match. See the figure below for all the legal 3-in-a-rows on one face of the pyramid. If no one wins outright, Black wins. This compensates for Red having the initiative at the beginning of the game.











Extended Play Variant
The standard rules for Sparro apply but with the following three changes:

1) Play continues until all 24 marbles have been played. The player with the most three-in-a-rows on the board at the end of the game wins. Note, when counting, count all unique three-in-a-rows. For example, four-in-a-row counts as two three-in-a-rows. Rows can intersect.

2) To resolve ties the following mechanism is used. A tie-breaker token, for example a gold doubloon or a white marble, is given to Black at the start of the game. From then on, the token belongs to whichever player last created a 3-in-row on the game board. If there is a tie between players for number of three-in-a-rows, the possessor of the token wins.

3) On Black first turn, if Red played to a corner space, Black must play to one of the eight edge center spaces, or, if Red played to an edge center space, Black must play to one of the four corner spaces. Thereafter, there are no further restrictions on either player. (This rule is to prevent symmetric play and an automatic win for Black.)

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
114686.name: Sparro

114687.name: The Company: Field Operations Manual
114687.description:
From the PDF:
ver wondered what it is like to jump out of an aircraft 50,000 feet above a stricken oil tanker? Or how you’d handle defusing an IED? Or what it is like standing between a visiting VIP and that sniper’s bullet? Well now you can because The Company will put you right at the centre of the action.

In The Company you play an employee of The Company – an elite independent Private Military Service Provider, a global security concern capable of dealing with any situation from a high octane firefight to the tracking down of serial killers. If you can think of it, The Company can handle it.

This 214 page Roleplaying game puts you in the boots of a member of The Company. Play a solider, a pilot, a surveillance officer or any other concept you can dream up that fits the setting.

The game uses a modified version OpenQuest, a straight forward d100 system, with extra rules to handle Guns, non-lethal weapons, mental trauma and Vehicles. All rules necessary to play are included.

It also contains pages of World information about Trouble hot spots, terrorist organisations, and Competitors to the company. A skill-full blend of real world information, written by someone who has worked in the UK Defence industry, and game-able fiction.
